title: Accumulation using Riemann sum from a table

content.question: A tank contains 50 liters of oil at time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoiaadshacq GH9aqpcaaI0aaaaa@3BF3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> hours. Oil is being pumped into the tank at a rate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamOuamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3CCE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamOuamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3CCE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> is measured in liters per hour, and t is measured in hours. Selected values of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoabaaaaaaa aapeGaamOuamaabmaapaqaa8qacaWG0baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3CCE@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> are given in the table above. Using a right Riemann sum with three subintervals and data from the table, what is the approximation of the number of liters of oil that are in the tank at time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeGabaakoiaadshacq GH9aqpcaaIXaGaaGynaaaa@3CAF@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> hours?

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
